author: Special Correspondent
text:
A day after the jail superintendent of Yerwada prison decided to let actor Sanjay Dutt out on ‘good conduct’, a petition was filed at the Bombay High Court to restrain his release.

Mr. Dutt is set to walk free on February 27, nearly 103 days before the end of his term.

The actor was sentenced to five years in jail in the 1993 bomb blasts case.

The petition to restrain his release was filed on Thursday by the chairperson of Samajik Karyakarta Saurakhan Samiti, Pradeep Bhalekar.

The petition alleges that Mr Dutt is getting a special treatment and points out that there are 27,740 others prisoners in the State who deserve to be released on the same grounds. It also says that the actor has already benefited a lot because of furlough and parole.

The petition also levels allegations against senior prison officials for favouring Mr. Dutt and demands an inquiry into the officials’ assets.

A Division Bench headed by acting Chief Justice VK Tahilramani heard the petition, directed the State to file its reply and posted the matter to next week.

Mr. Dutt was convicted for illegal possession of an automatic assault rifle, a part of cache of arms and ammunition that landed ahead of the 1993 Mumbai serial blasts, in which 257 people were killed.
title: Petition against Sanjay Dutt’s release
